author: Alexander Bolton
description: Democratic senators say that unless Republicans scrap their plan to advance a “clean” seven-week continuing resolution, they don’t see any option other than defeating it as a way to send a “message” to President Trump. Doing so would almost certainly trigger a government shutdown, something Democrats avoided earlier this year but is increasingly looking inevitable…
title: Democrats say shutdown necessary to send ‘message’ to Trump

author: Tara Suter
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s (D) press office said President Trump was “making things up again” after Trump made a claim about low-income housing in an area of Los Angeles destroyed by wildfires. On Tuesday, Trump posted on his Truth Social platform that he had “just learned, that Gavin Newscum, the Governor of California, is in final…
title: Newsom office fires back after Trump low-income housing claim: ‘Take your dementia meds’

author: Emily Brooks
description: House Republicans on Wednesday advanced a funding stopgap to avert an end-of-month government shutdown, teeing up a final vote on the continuing resolution (CR) later this week and setting up a showdown with Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) and Senate Democrats. The rule advancing the funding stopgap was approved in a party-line 216-210 vote,…
title: House Republicans advance funding stopgap, tee up vote this week

author: Sylvan Lane
description: Welcome to The Hill’s Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Fed cuts rates as threats to job market rise The Federal Reserve cut interest rates Wednesday for the first time this year as the central bank attempts to ease pressure on the weakening U.S. job market.…
title: Fed cuts rates as job gains plunge

author: Rachel Frazin
description: In response to the Trump administration repeatedly saying otherwise, the National Academies of Science, Engineering and Medicine on Wednesday issued a report that emphasized that climate change’s harms are “beyond scientific dispute.” The report from the National Academies, which seek to provide science that informs the government, comes as a rebuke to the Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA)…
title: National Academies: Climate change’s harms ‘beyond scientific dispute’

author: Filip Timotija
description: Tyson Foods said this week it plans to halt the use of high fructose corn syrup in its products by the end of this year.  The Arkansas-based food producer announced on Monday that, in addition to pausing the use of high fructose corn syrup, it also plans to halt the use of sucralose, the preservative…
title: Tyson Foods planning to halt use of high fructose corn syrup in its products

author: Alex Gangitano
description: King Charles on Wednesday praised President Trump for his peace efforts at the United Kingdom state dinner, highlighting that the president is committed to finding solutions to global conflicts. “Our countries are working together in support of crucial diplomatic efforts, not least of which, Mr. President, is your own personal commitment to finding solutions to…
title: King Charles lauds Trump’s peace efforts at massive UK state dinner

author: Filip Timotija
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) said for the first time on Wednesday that Israel is committing “genocide” in its war against the Palestinian militant group Hamas in the Gaza Strip.  Sanders, among the most outspoken critics of Israel’s government in Congress, said Israel has the right to defend itself after Hamas’s Oct. 7, 2023, attack, during…
title: Bernie Sanders: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
Trump, first lady join royal family in UK state visit: In photos

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Sen. Tim Kaine (D-Va.) apologized to ousted Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Director Susan Monarez for questioning her “backbone” during her confirmation hearing in June. “You got over the qualifications bar easily, but my worries about the direction of HHS [Health and Human Services] made me question you very significantly on your backbone,…
title: Tim Kaine apologizes to ex-CDC director: ‘I was wrong’

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The creators of “South Park” say they will delay a new episode previously scheduled for Wednesday until next week. “Apparently when you do everything at the last minute sometimes you don’t get it done,” creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone said in a statement issued through Comedy Central on Wednesday. “This one’s on us. We…
title: ‘South Park’ delays new episode at the last minute: ‘This one’s on us’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Andrew Kolvet, executive producer of “The Charlie Kirk Show,” said the late conservative activist would have wanted Comedy Central to continue airing a “South Park” episode that lampooned him. “Hey @paramountplus, as someone who can speak with some authority on this, Charlie loved that he was featured in South Park,” Kolvet wrote in a post…
title: Exec producer of ‘Charlie Kirk Show’ says he would want ‘South Park’ episode made available

author: Filip Timotija
description: Another seaside home along the Outer Banks in North Carolina collapsed into the Atlantic Ocean this week, the 12th collapse on the Seashore beaches over the past five years. The unoccupied house collapsed Tuesday evening during the high waves from the coastal storm.  The Cape Hatteras National Seashore is urging visitors to avoid the beach…
title: Another Outer Banks home collapses into Atlantic Ocean

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A veteran pleaded not guilty on Wednesday after setting fire to an American flag in a federal park outside the White House last month to protest President Trump’s executive order cracking down on flag burning. Jan Carey, 54, was arraigned on two federal misdemeanor charges, at his first court appearance on Wednesday: igniting a fire…
title: Veteran pleads not guilty in flag burning near White House

author: Tara Suter
description: Sports commentator Stephen A. Smith said Tuesday he has “no problem” with President Trump sending the National Guard to Chicago. “In the city of Chicago, I don’t give a damn what they say, I have no problem with sending in the National Guard. They were a problem before [former President] Obama got into office, when…
title: Stephen A. Smith: ‘No problem’ with Trump sending National Guard to Chicago

author: Max Rego
description: Just 35 percent of respondents to a Walton Family Foundation-Gallup poll released Tuesday are satisfied with the state of K-12 education in the United States.  That marks the lowest satisfaction level since Gallup began conducting the poll in 1999. The poll, conducted over the phone from Aug. 1 to Aug. 20, found that 7 percent…
title: Satisfaction with K-12 education drops to record low: Gallup

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: All Democrats on the Senate Armed Services Committee on Wednesday asked the panel’s chairman to hold a public hearing “at the earliest opportunity” with Pentagon officials to address the Trump administration’s increasing deployments of military service members to American cities. In a letter to Chairman Roger Wicker (R-Miss.), the 13 Democratic senators say they’re concerned with the…
title: Senate Democrats call for hearing on Trump use of military in US cities

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Ironically, Bondi could have avoided this mess had she listened more closely to one specific person: Charlie Kirk.
title: MAGA wants Pam Bondi to resign over Charlie Kirk hate speech comment

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz (D) on Tuesday slammed President Trump for not speaking compassionately about slain state Rep. Melissa Hortman (D) after she and her husband, Mark, were gunned down in their home. “There’s no compassion, there’s no empathy in this man, and there’s no sense of governing for the whole country,” Walz said during…
title: Walz on Trump remarks about slain Minnesota lawmaker: ‘No compassion’

author: Marc Siegel, opinion contributor
description: It is disheartening that what was a great historical public health accomplishment has deteriorated to a political battle.
title: The CDC and COVID vaccine deserve scrutiny, not elimination

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Republican senators Wednesday attempted to undermine the testimony of former Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Director Susan Monarez by attacking the attorneys she retained after being ousted.  GOP Sens. Jim Banks (Ind.) and Ashley Moody (Fla.) questioned why Monarez is being represented by lawyers who have vocally criticized President Trump.    Mark Zaid…
title: GOP senators attack ‘anti-Trump’ attorneys working for fired CDC director

author: Nia McMillan
description: Chesterfield County Public Schools has announced the resignation of school board member Dorothy Heffron after a controversial social media post made in the aftermath of Charlie Kirk's assassination.
title: ‘It has been an honor’: Virginia school board member resigns after comments on Charlie Kirk assassination

author: Sandi Henderson, opinion contributor
description: Despite the growing prevalence and impact of obesity in America, it took Medicare over 40 years to cover bariatric surgery, one of the first treatments for the disease. The decades-long delay in providing coverage for bariatric surgery in Medicare meant that an entire generation of Americans died from obesity-related diseases while waiting for access to…
title: Medicare should cover GLP-1 obesity drugs

author: Max Rego
description: Illinois state Sen. Meg Loughran Cappel (D) said shots were fired at her home in Shorewood, Ill., on Tuesday morning.  Cappel, who said she and her family are safe, called the incident “deeply troubling” in a Wednesday post on Facebook. The senator also thanked Shorewood Chief of Police Phillip Arnold, law enforcement and investigators for…
title: Shots fired at Illinois lawmaker’s home

author: Julia Shapero
description: A bipartisan group of senators requested documents from Meta on Tuesday on its safety research and policies after several whistleblowers accused the company of stifling internal studies on safety risks.  In a letter to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Sens. Marsha Blackburn (R-Tenn.), Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.), Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa), Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) and six others pressed…
title: Senators request documents from Meta on safety research

author: Joseph Choi
description: Susan Monarez, former director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), said Wednesday that Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. was “very upset” in their final meeting, in which she claimed he asked her to give blanket approval to vaccine guidance without seeing evidence to support it. Since she was…
title: Monarez says RFK Jr. was ‘very upset’ and ‘very animated’ in final meeting

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: Donald Trump's pledge to restore prayer in public schools may please his base, but it also strengthens the hand of whoever comes after him and could lead to a future where the government dictates religious practice in classrooms.
title: Trump’s prayer push is a time bomb for America

author: Emily Brooks
description: Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) on Wednesday fired back at Rep. Nancy Mace’s (R-S.C.) suggestion that “maybe Somalia can take you back,” calling the South Carolina congresswoman not “well or smart.” The back-and-forth came as Mace promoted her resolution to censure Omar and remove her from her committee assignments after Mace charged the Minnesota Democrat “smeared Charlie Kirk…
title: Omar says Mace not ‘well or smart’ for suggesting ‘Somalia can take you back’

author: Ashley Suter
description: Forecasters said there is some uncertainty in the forecast as Gabrielle's center could be re-forming to the north.
title: Tropical Storm Gabrielle forms in the Atlantic

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: ABC reporter Matt Gutman apologized Wednesday for comments he made on air while reporting on text messages sent between conservative activist Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin and his roommate just after the killing. “Yesterday I tried to underscore the jarring contrast between this cold blooded assassination of Charlie Kirk — a man who dedicated his life…
title: ABC reporter apologizes for calling Charlie Kirk alleged assassin’s texts ‘touching’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The wife of late Russian opposition leader Alex Navalny said foreign lab results concluded that he was poisoned while serving out a prison sentence at an Arctic penal colony. “We managed to transfer Alexei’s biological materials abroad. Laboratories in two different countries conducted examinations. These laboratories, independently of each other, concluded that Alexei was poisoned,” Yulia…
title: Wife says testing shows Navalny was poisoned before death

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A driver rammed their car into the FBI security gate at the Pittsburgh bureau early Wednesday and then fled the scene, according to officials. The suspect, later identified as Donald Henson, threw an American flag over the gate after the impact around 2:40 a.m. EDT and then ran away on foot, an official told The…
title: Car rams gate at FBI building in Pittsburgh

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump will spend the majority of Wednesday at Windsor Castle in the United Kingdom. They were greeted upon arrival by Prince William and Kate, the princess of Wales, as well as King Charles III and Queen Camilla. The trip marks Trump’s second state visit to the UK since returning to…
title: Watch live: Trump, first lady honor late Queen Elizabeth II, visit Windsor Castle

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Sen. Chris Coons (D-Del.) rebuffed comments FBI Director Kash Patel made Tuesday during a tense oversight hearing, calling Patel’s testimony “a performance.” “It was a performance. He was testifying really for an audience of one: President Trump,” Coons said during a Tuesday appearance on CNN’s “AC360.” “During his confirmation hearing months ago, I asked him…
title: Senate Democrat: Patel ‘was testifying really for an audience of one: President Trump’

author: Kim Wehle, opinion contributor
description: Since the tragic assassination of conservative political commentator Charlie Kirk, there has been a disturbing crackdown on free speech that stretches across ideological divides. People can debate whether what is being said about Kirk’s death and his legacy is okay or not okay. But believe it or not, that is mostly beside the point when…
title: Don’t let Charlie Kirk’s death become pretext for a free speech crackdown

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Charlie Kirk’s assassination has reignited worries about judges’ security.  A sharp rise in threats against the judiciary has made concern over political violence a constant drumbeat, from state courts to the Supreme Court.  But the fatal shooting of the prominent conservative activist has injected a new urgency into the conversation.  “I think it is a…
title: Kirk killing puts judge threats top of mind

author: Artem Kolisnichenko, opinion contributor
description: The New Democrats want to move away from the usual extremes of cruelty vs. amnesty, instead offering a pragmatic balance.
title: Democrats need a new, pragmatic message on immigration

author: Lee Zeldin, opinion contributor
description: The EPA is implementing a deregulatory agenda to make America the AI capital of the world, while also protecting the environment, by streamlining data center approval timelines, modernizing regulations for oil and gas wastewater discharges, and using AI to train internal systems.
title: EPA has a huge role in American AI dominance

author: Brett Samuels
description: The head of an advocacy group founded by former Vice President Pence wrote to the top two Republicans in Congress, urging them to take up and pass a fresh round of sanctions against Russia over its ongoing war in Ukraine. In a letter obtained first by The Hill, Advancing American Freedom president Tim Chapman called…
title: Pence group writes to GOP leaders urging passage of Russian sanctions

description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump kick off two days of pomp and business with their state visit to the U.K. on Wednesday morning, arriving at Windsor Castle. Prince William and Kate, the princess of Wales, and then King Charles III and Queen Camilla, will greet the Trumps. A state banquet at the castle…
title: Live updates: Trump starts UK visit with royal welcome

author: Brandon Conradis
description: Democratic candidate Xp Lee is projected to win the special election to replace slain former Minnesota House Speaker Melissa Hortman (DFL), who was assassinated during a shooting in June that also killed her husband, according to Decision Desk HQ.  Lee, a health equity analyst, defeated Republican candidate Ruth Bittner, a real estate agent, for a…
title: Democrat wins Minnesota special election to replace slain lawmaker
